business.headline: India on track to surpass Japan's GDP, could overtake Germany by 2027: IMFIndia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) has more than doubled in the past decade, rising from $2.1 trillion in 2015 to an estimated $4.3 trillion in 2025.

Top stocks to watch today: IREDA, BHEL, ONGC, HCLTech, IRFC, NCC and moreTop stocks to watch on March 26: Sensex and Nifty aim to extend gains as markets track global cues. Key stocks in focus include ONGC, Maruti, HCLTech, and NCC amid corporate developments and investment moves shaping today's session.

Sensex, Nifty opening predictions on March 26: What to expect today?Over the last seven sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have risen 5.7%, turning positive for the year so far. This rally has been supported by foreign capital inflows and expectations of stronger domestic economic growth.

BYD overtakes Tesla in 2024 revenue, becomes World's top EV makerBYD surpassed Tesla in revenue, reporting $107 billion in 2024. The Chinese EV giant leads China's auto market, while Tesla faces declining sales, boycotts, and a falling valuation amid industry challenges.

Wall Street drifts ahead of report on US consumer confidenceWall Street saw marginal gains on Tuesday after making gains a day earlier in hopes of the Trump administration potentially softening its next set of tariffs.
ATM cash withdrawals to get costlier from May 1. Here's whyThe Reserve Bank of India has approved a hike in ATM interchange fees, raising cash withdrawal costs for customers from May 1, 2025.

Government drops import duty on key parts for EV batteries, phonesFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the government will exempt import duty on 35 items used to make EV batteries and 28 items used in mobile phone manufacturing.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to close flat amid tariff uncertainty; Zomato down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex closed just 32.81 points above at 78,017.19 after having gained nearly 700 points in the day. Nifty also followed a similar pattern as it ended with just a 10.30 point gain at 23,668.65.

Air India staff to fly economy as airline tackles passenger concerns: ReportThe move is part of Air India's effort to improve its service and customer experience, following criticism over frequent flight delays.

India open to tariff cuts on US imports worth $23 billion: ReportThe government is trying to reduce the impact of US President Donald Trump's global reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect from April 2.
What is Google tax that India is likely to scrap from April 1?The tax is expected to be scrapped from April 1, 2025, as part of amendments to the Finance Bill.

entertainment.headline: Priyanka Chopra celebrates 'freedom' after daughter Malti sleeps, shares funny memePriyanka Chopra shared a hilarious meme about enjoying 'freedom' after Malti sleeps. She had earlier reacted to Malti putting herself back to sleep, calling it a 'win'.

Ben Affleck finds it 'embarrassing' to discuss divorce from Jennifer LopezActor Ben Affleck addressed his split from Jennifer Lopez. He dismissed the drama and praised his ex-wife Jennifer Garner in a recent interview.

Sadia Khateeb shares dream Iftar guest list: Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, and SRKBollywood actor Sadia Khateeb shared her dream iftar guest list featuring Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, and Shah Rukh Khan, revealing her reasons for wanting to dine with these superstars.

Mohanlal prays for friend Mammooty at Sabarimala, responds as controversy eruptsActor Mohanlal performed a special pooja at Sabarimala on March 18. This sparked controversy regarding the Hindu-Muslim faith to which Mohanlal responded at a Chennai event.

Sonali Bendre fractures hand after a fall, concerned fans wish her speedy recoveryActor Sonali Bendre was seen at Mumbai airport with a fractured hand but cheerfully interacted with paparazzi. Fans wished her speedy recovery.

Nick Jonas says daughter Malti is unaware of his fame, calls band 'Donut Brothers'Nick Jonas said daughter Malti is unaware of his stardom and just wants to play 'Moana and Maui' with him. He embraced being a 'girl dad' while Kevin Jonas shared how his daughter is realising the popularity of her father.

Sonu Sood's wife sustained multiple bruises, under observation: HospitalActor Sonu Sood's wife, Sonali Sood, was involved in a car accident along with her sister and nephew. According to the hospital statement, she suffered multiple bruises and is currently stable under observation.

Kamal Haasan shocked as his dear friend Bharathiraja grieves loss of son ManojKamal Haasan offered condolences to director Bharathiraja and family after Manoj Bharathiraja's passing. Manoj died of heart attack on March 25. He was 48.

Final Destination Bloodlines trailer: Death is back to claim lives once againThe Final Destination saga will continue with Bloodlines, the trailer of which was released today, March 25. The film will once again bring back Death and his inventive ways of killing people.

Pedro Pascal on a 5-year leap in The Last of Us Season 2: Incredibly comfortingDuring a press conference, Pedro Pascal shared insights on the emotional challenges of returning to The Last of Us for its second season. He discussed his mindset and the evolving relationship with co-star Bella Ramsey.

Kim Sae-ron's ex-boyfriend denies Kim Soo-hyun's involvement in her deathKim Sae-ron's ex-boyfriend has denied Kim Soo-hyun's involvement in her death, alleging abuse in her marriage. The actress's secret marriage and alleged emotional distress are under scrutiny.

Arjun Kapoor remembers mother Mona on 13th death anniversary: Love you, alwaysActor Arjun Kapoor remembers his mother, Mona Shourie Kapoor, on the 13th anniversary of her passing. He shares an emotional tribute, reflecting on her enduring influence and the pain of her absence.

Tamil actor-director Manoj Bharathiraja dies at 48 in ChennaiTamil actor and director Manoj Bharathiraja, son of legendary director Bharathiraja, died of heart attack at his Chetpet residence in Chennai on March 25. He was 48 years old.
George Clooney is done with romantic filmsHollywood star George Clooney is no longer in the mood to make any romantic films. The veteran actor said he doesn't want to compete with younger actors.

Tony Kakkar defends Neha Kakkar after Melbourne concert delaySinger Tony Kakkar defended sister Neha Kakkar after she arrived three hours late to her Melbourne concert. He blamed the organisers for the delay.

Solo Leveling 2: Sung Jinwoo-Ant King Beru clash makes episode 12 a visual treatThe 12th episode of Solo Leveling aired on Saturday, thrilling fans with an intense battle scene as Sung Jinwoo clashed with Ant King Beru on Jeju Island. Was it the best Solo Leveling episode so far? Read on to know.

Reema Kagti on rising star salaries: Pressure on budgets is ridiculousReema Kagti spoke out about the unsustainable pressure rising star salaries are placing on film budgets, while also highlighting the issue of pay disparity between male and female actors.

Adolescence, brilliance of British crime shows, and why US is losing the genre warWith 'Adolescence' winning all over, it is the right time to discuss why British crime dramas are built to last as compared to the ones made in the US in the same genre.

Test trailer: Nayanthara, R Madhavan's dreams get intertwined in upcoming thrillerNetflix has unveiled the trailer for 'Test', a Tamil film directed by S Sashikanth. The film follows a cricketer, scientist, and teacher as they face personal and professional challenges, premiering on Netflix April 4.

general news.headline: CBI raids Bhupesh Baghel in Chhattisgarh in Mahadev betting app case, he reactsDays after the ED conducted searches, the CBI today raided the residences of Congress General Secretary and former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel in Raipur and Bhilai in connection with the Mahadev betting app case.

Trump signs big election order mandating citizenship proof, cites India exampleDonald Trump has signed a sweeping executive order will drastically alter American voter registration processes, imposing stringent measures.

AIADMK leader, Amit Shah meet: Patch-up with BJP ahead of 2026 Tamil Nadu polls?Union Home Minister Amit Shah met Tamil Nadu leader of Opposition and AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami in Delhi on Tuesday. Their meeting has sparked speculation of the BJP reuniting with AIADMK ahead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu elections.

Kerala Chief Secretary slams remark against her dark skin, says 'I dig black'Kerala Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan in a Facebook post, slammed a remark comparing her leadership to her husband's that was linked with her skin colour. Through her post, she called out deep-rooted bias against dark skin.
Oversharing isn't just mindless chatter, it could be silent cry for connectionWe often look down on oversharers, but experts explain that, for some, it may be a silent call for connection.

Hands tied, mouth taped: Haryana yoga teacher buried alive over suspected affairJagdeep, a yoga teacher at a private university in Rohtak, was kidnapped in December 2024 and buried alive in a pit that was seven feet deep. His body was recovered on March 24.

Couple deported after 35 years in California, their 3 US-born daughters in shockA couple who had been living in the US for 35 years, with no criminal history after coming to America and having three US-born children, have been deported to their native Colombia.

Trump's adviser admits Yemen strikes chat leak, President downplays breachUS National Security Adviser, Michael Waltz, admitted to mistakenly adding journalist Jeffrey Goldberg to a chat regarding Yemen military actions, while Donald Trump downplayed the incident, deflecting the blame to one of his White House staffers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
